title: Mavericks vs. Spurs Post-Game Stats: Victor Wembanyama's 40-Point Outburst Spoils Cooper Flagg's NBA Debut
text:
Mavericks vs. Spurs Post-Game Stats: Victor Wembanyama’s 40-Point Outburst Spoils Cooper Flagg’s NBA Debut
The San Antonio Spurs routed the Dallas Mavericks 125-92 in their season opener, thanks to a stellar performance by Victor Wembanyama. The 7-foot-5 center registered an impressive 40 points, securing a double-double with 15 rebounds and three blocks, while rookie Dylan Harper added 15 points. The Mavericks struggled without injured star Kyrie Irving, as Anthony Davis and Klay Thompson couldn't find their rhythm, with Davis shooting only 31.8% from the field. Rookie Cooper Flagg debuted with a double-double of his own but faced shooting challenges, posting 10 points on 30.8% accuracy.
- Victor Wembanyama: 40 points, 15 rebounds, 71.4% FG
- Anthony Davis: 22 points, 13 rebounds, 7-of-22 shooting
- Cooper Flagg: 10 points, 10 rebounds, 30.8% FG
- Spurs secured a dominant 33-point victory over the Mavericks.
- Mavericks struggled without Kyrie Irving, affecting their performance.
- Upcoming games: Mavericks vs. Wizards, Spurs vs. Pelicans.
The Mavericks will need to regroup and seek offensive consistency in their next game against the Wizards. Meanwhile, the Spurs will look to build on their momentum as they head to New Orleans to face the Pelicans.
Bottom LineThe Spurs showcased their potential with a standout performance from Wembanyama, while the Mavericks must improve their shooting and overall team dynamic to avoid further losses this season.
Read more at www.totalprosports.com
